name: cliched
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C2 often said, used, or done, and therefore not original and not interesting: He made some clichéd remark. It might sound clichéd, but knowing that you're doing something worthwhile makes a big difference. See
cliché
More examplesFewer examplesThere are many highly clichéd phrases that executives like to use.It's a rather clichéd story.Ideas don't become clichéd because they're false, but because they're true.
